SubIndicatorTextImage.heading: What is a career training program?
SubIndicatorTextImage.subhead: Postsecondary education isn’t just about getting a college degree! Did you know that there are programs after high school where you can get trained for a specific job or career that you want to work in? These are called career training programs and usually involve taking hand-on learning classes so that you can qualify for a specialized certification. This makes you way more desirable to an employer who is looking to hire someone with more training and experience (like you!).
SubIndicatorTextImage.bullets:
• Which career are you interested in being trained to work in?
  • Does the career or job that you want require any specific certifications?
  • What job skills would you like to learn through a career training program?

SubIndicatorTextImage.heading: What does a postsecondary career training program include?
SubIndicatorTextImage.subhead: This Transition Planning Infographic collection describes the 4 sub-indicators through definitions, characteristics, outcomes, and meaningful stories.
SubIndicatorTextImage.bullets:
• Opportunities to learn specialized skills for a specific job or career that you want
  • Courses that teach what you’ll need to know when working in a specific job or career
  • Networking with employers and other individuals who can help you get into the career that you want
  • Completing coursework that prepares you to complete exams for specialized certificates

SubIndicatorVideoImage.heading: What’s career training all about? Let’s unpack it!

IconTile2Heading.heading: What can career training programs do for you?

IconTile2.heading: Job Skills
IconTile2.content: Having the specialized skills that you need to succeed in the job that you want

IconTile2.heading: Certifications
IconTile2.content: Obtaining one or more certifications that not only make you able to get hired and succeed in specific jobs, but that also help you get promoted faster!

IconTile2.heading: Job Networking
IconTile2.content: Building connections with potential employers who can hire you once you get your certification

IconTile2.heading: Competitive Jobs
IconTile2.content: Being able to get hired in fields and careers that are competitive and that pay you a good salary with benefits

testimonialList.title: Transition-age youth
testimonialList.description: Part of the idea behind the program I attended was to help me earn a certificate in childcare. I had to sit in a classroom but also had chances to work with young kids, which I loved. After I graduated my vocational rehabilitation counselor helped me get a job working in a preschool program. It is always what I wanted to do and I am happy!
